__TOC__


Today's Bug Day will focus on ubiquity - the Live CD installer.  Since <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/testing|Hardy Beta]]</nowiki> was recently released, we felt it would be a good idea to focus on ubiquity bugs to help ensure everyone has a pleasant experience installing Ubuntu. 

Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.  

You might find it more convenient to edit the wiki page using <code>editmoin</code> a command line utility for editing moinmoin wiki pages.  It is available as a package in Gutsy and Hardy.  More information including an easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad. 

=== 150 bugs with status "New" about ubiquity ===
These bugs have not yet been triaged.  Detailed information about debugging ubiquity can be found at the <nowiki>[[DebuggingUbiquity]]</nowiki> page.  A reply you might want to use is 
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Ask the reporter for more detailed information, subscribe yourself to the bug and mark it "Incomplete" '''or'''
* Set it "Confirmed" and set an importance (if you are not a QA member ask someone for help)

=== 41 bugs with an "Incomplete" status ===
These bugs have had some initial triage done and may or may not have had a response from the original reporter.  We can either set the status to "Confirmed" or if there is absolutely not enough information for anyone to recreate the bug then it should be set to a status of "Invalid".

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Set the status to "Confirmed" if the reporter has provided the requested information '''or'''
* Set the status to "Invalid" if the reporter had not responsed and there is no way anyone could work on the bug '''or'''
* Set the status to "Confirmed" and the prioirty to "Low" if the reporter has not responsed and there may be enough information for someone to work on it
